com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.parameter

Interface CommandArgument

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmojiArgument, EmoteArgument, GenericCommandArgument, InvalidMentionArgument, InvalidRoleArgument, InvalidTextChannelArgument, InvalidUserArgument, MemberArgument, MentionArgument, RoleArgument, TextChannelArgument, UserArgument

    public interface CommandArgument
    This represents a space separated argument in a Command. Mentions are eagerly evaluated while everything else is lazily evaluated. Methods begging in parse do not store the return value and as such, each call parses the content again.

      • getEvent

        CommandEvent getEvent()
        Gets the CommandEvent for this argument.
        Returns:
        a CommandEvent

      • getArgument

        java.lang.String getArgument()
        Returns the backing string of this argument in it's original form.
        Returns:
        The underlying string for this argument.

      • getClient

        default BreadBot getClient()
        Returns the command client
        Returns:
        a BreadBotClient

      • isMention

        default boolean isMention()
        If this method returns true, that means this argument has been eagerly evaluated to a mention. This argument would be of type
        • User Mention
        • Member Mention
        • Role Mention
        • TextChannel Mention
        • Emote
        If this mention returns false then this argument is not a mention.
        Returns:
        true if this is a properly formatted mention, false otherwise.

      • getAsType

        default <T> T getAsType(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Grabs the corresponding parser from the BreadBotClient and attempts to parse this argument to the passed type. If successful, return the result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type
        Parameters:
        type - the class of the type
        Returns:
        the result if can be parsed, otherwise null.

      • matches

        default boolean matches(java.lang.String regex)
        Invocation is exactly the same as: 
        
     this.getArgument().matches(regex)
        Parameters:
        regex - the regular expression to which this string is to be matched
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this string matches the given regular expression

        default boolean matches(java.util.regex.Pattern pattern)
        Invocation is exactly the same as: 
        
     pattern.matcher(this.getArgument()).matches()
        Parameters:
        pattern - the regex Pattern to match the argument with.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, this string matches the given regular pattern

      • isNumeric

        default boolean isNumeric()
        Checks whether the underlying string consists of only digits with an exception of - or + at the beginning.

        Result is equivalent to a regex of: 

        
     [-+]?[0-9]+
        Returns:
        true if and only if this argument only contains 0-9 with an optional prefix of - or +

      • isInteger

        default boolean isInteger()
        Equivalent to isNumeric() but also checks that the number is within the range of an integer
        Returns:
        true if and only if this argument only contains 0-9 with an optional prefix of - or + and the number does not exceed Integer.MAX_VALUE or Integer.MIN_VALUE

      • parseInt

        default int parseInt()
        Parses the argument as an Integer with Integer.parseInt(String)
        Returns:
        an int
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if isInteger() returns false

      • isLong

        default boolean isLong()
        Equivalent to isNumeric() but also checks that the number is within the range of an integer
        Returns:
        true if and only if this argument only contains 0-9 with an optional prefix of - or + and the number does not exceed Long.MAX_VALUE or Long.MIN_VALUE

      • parseLong

        default long parseLong()
        Parses the argument as an Long with Long.parseLong(String)
        Returns:
        a long
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if isInteger() returns false

      • isFloat

        default boolean isFloat()
        Checks the expression against the regex provided in Double.valueOf(String)

      • parseFloat

        default float parseFloat()
        Parses the argument as an Long with Long.parseLong(String)
        Returns:
        a float
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if isFloat() returns false

      • parseDouble

        default double parseDouble()
        Parses the argument as an Long with Double.parseDouble(String)
        Returns:
        a double
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if isFloat() returns false

      • isRange

        default boolean isRange()
        A range is defined as two positive integers separated by a dash with no whitespace eg 23-54

        Checks whether the underlying string consists of at least 2 digits separated by a dash

        Result is equivalent to a regex of: 

        
     [0-9]+-[0-9]+
        Returns:
        true if it matches the format required.

      • parseRange

        default java.util.stream.IntStream parseRange()
        Parses this argument as an inclusive range and returns an IntStream consisting of the elements in the stream in the order declared

        For example, an argument of "2-6" will return a stream of [2,3,4,5,6] and an argument of "8-5" will return a stream of [8,7,6,5].

        This method CAN be used in cases where isRange() would return false. If the argument is a single integer, where isInteger() would return true, an IntStream with a single value will be returned.

        Returns:
        an ordered IntStream. If isRange() AND isInteger() would return false, null will be returned.

      • isHex

        default boolean isHex()
        Checks if this matches a hexadecimal number, specifically whether this argument consists of digits 0-10 and/or letters a-f optionally prefixed by # or 0x The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of (#|0x)?[0-9a-fA-F]+
        Returns:
        true if it matches the format required.

      • parseIntFromHex

        default int parseIntFromHex()
        Parses hexadecimal into an int
        Returns:
        an int
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if isHex() would return false

      • isBoolean

        default boolean isBoolean()
        Please refer to Arguments.isBoolean(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        true if this can be parsed to a boolean. false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Arguments.isBoolean(String)

      • parseBoolean

        default boolean parseBoolean()

      • isUser

        boolean isUser()
        Checks if this argument is a User mention. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <@(!)?[0-9]+>
        Returns:
        true if this is a formatted User mention.

      • isValidUser

        boolean isValidUser()
        Checks if this argument is a User mention that can be correctly resolved to a User. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <@(!)?[0-9]+> and then checking to see if JDA has knowledge of a User with that id.

        If this method returns false and isUser() returns true, this CommandArgument is can be cast to an InvalidMentionArgument

        Returns:
        true if this is a formatted User mention that can be resolved to an entity.

      • getUser

        default net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.User getUser()
        If this is a User mention, will return the specified user.
        Returns:
        The User if found by JDA.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isValidUser() would return false

      • isValidMember

        boolean isValidMember()
        First checks if the argument is a User mention. Then attempts to resolve that mention to a User. If the User is found, the User will be checked against the Guild to see if it is a Member.
        Returns:
        true if the Member can be resolved to a valid JDA entity. Otherwise false

      • getMember

        default net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Member getMember()
        The Member if it can be resolved.
        Returns:
        The Member if found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isValidMember() would return false

      • findMember

        java.util.Optional<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Member> findMember()
        Searches for a member in the Guild using the argument as criteria. If it matches multiple users, the user whose name begins with the argument is given precedence. If multiple users match, the first one found is returned. This attempts to match Username and Nickname.

        If this argument is already a valid Member mention, that Member is returned within the Optional.

        Returns:
        the first Member found, otherwise an empty Optional

      • searchMembers

        java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Member> searchMembers()
        Searches for members whose Username or Nickname contains this argument.

        If this argument is already a valid Member mention, a List with only that element is returned.

        Returns:
        A never-null List of Members

      • isRole

        boolean isRole()
        Checks if this argument is of the same format as a Role mention. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <@&[0-9]+>.
        Returns:
        true if this argument is formatted as a Role mention

      • isValidRole

        boolean isValidRole()
        Checks if this argument is a Role mention. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <@&[0-9]+> and checking if it can be correctly resolved to a Role within the Guild.
        Returns:
        true if this is a valid Role mention that can be resolved to a valid JDA entity.

      • getRole

        default net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Role getRole()
        Attempts to resolve this argument to a Role in the Guild. If isRole() would return true, it is guaranteed that this method returns a non-null value.
        Returns:
        Role if role is present within the Guild, otherwise null
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isValidRole() would return false

      • findRole

        java.util.Optional<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Role> findRole()
        Attempts to match this argument to a Role by name.

        If this argument is already a valid Role mention, that Role is returned within the Optional.

        Returns:
        the first Role found, otherwise an empty Optional

      • searchRoles

        java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Role> searchRoles()
        Returns a List of Roles that match this argument. The criteria being that the Role name should contain this argument.

        If this argument is already a valid Role mention, a List with only that element is returned.

        Returns:
        A never-null List of Roles.

      • isTextChannel

        boolean isTextChannel()
        Checks if this argument is a TextChannel mention. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <#[0-9]+>
        Returns:
        true if this is a correctly formatted TextChannel mention

      • isValidTextChannel

        boolean isValidTextChannel()
        Checks if this argument is a TextChannel mention that can be correctly resolved to a TextChannel. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <#[0-9]+> and then checking to see if JDA has knowledge of a TextChannel with that id.

        If this method returns false and isTextChannel() returns true, this CommandArgument is can be cast to an InvalidMentionArgument

        Returns:
        true if this is a formatted TextChannel mention and can be correctly resolved to a JDA entity.

      • getTextChannel

        default net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.TextChannel getTextChannel()
        Attempts to resolve this argument as a TextChannel mention to a TextChannel in the Guild.

        If isTextChannel() would return true, it is guaranteed that this method returns a non-null value.

        Returns:
        TextChannel if can be resolved to a JDA entity
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isValidTextChannel() would return false

      • findTextChannel

        java.util.Optional<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.TextChannel> findTextChannel()
        Attempts to match this argument to a TextChannel by name.

        If this argument is already a valid TextChannel mention, that TextChannel is returned within the Optional.

        Returns:
        the first TextChannel found, otherwise an empty Optional

      • searchTextChannels

        java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.TextChannel> searchTextChannels()
        Returns a List of TextChannels that match this argument. The criteria being that the TextChannel name should contain this argument.

        If this argument is already a valid TextChannel mention, a List with only that element is returned.

        Returns:
        A never-null List of TextChannels.

      • findVoiceChannel

        java.util.Optional<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.VoiceChannel> findVoiceChannel()
        Attempts to match this argument to a VoiceChannel by name.
        Returns:
        the first VoiceChannel if found, otherwise an empty Optional

      • searchVoiceChannels

        java.util.List<net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.VoiceChannel> searchVoiceChannels()
        Returns a List of Roles that match this argument. The criteria being that the VoiceChannel name should contain this argument.
        Returns:
        A never-null List of VoiceChannels.

      • isEmote

        boolean isEmote()
        Checks if this argument is in a valid Emote mention form. The result of this method is equivalent to checking this argument against a regex of <:.+:[0-9]+>
        Returns:
        true if this argument matches the format required

      • getEmote

        default net.dv8tion.jda.core.entities.Emote getEmote()
        If isEmote() would return true, this method will always return a not-null value, null otherwise. If the formatting is correct but JDA cannot resolve the Emote, a Fake Emote will be returned.

        If isEmote() would return true, it is guaranteed that this method returns a non-null value.

        Returns:
        An Emote if the formatting is correct. Otherwise null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isEmote() would return false

      • isEmoji

        boolean isEmoji()
        Will attempt to match this argument against the emojis found in Emoji using their unicode value. The implementation of this method is 
        
     return getEmoji()() != null
        Returns:
        true if an Emoji was successfully matched.

      • getEmoji

        default Emoji getEmoji()
        Attempts to find a matching Emoji with Emoji.find(String)
        Returns:
        The Emoji if matched.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if isEmoji() would return false
